name: Yo-Sub Han
content: Yo-Sub Han - Homepage Yo-Sub Han Professor School of Computing Yonsei University Seoul 03722, Republic of Korea Email: emmous [at] yonsei [dot] ac [dot] kr I am a computer science theoretician and am working in the department of computer science at Yonsei University since March 2009. I belong to the theory of computation lab. I studied at POSTECH (South Korea) and at HKUST (Hong Kong), and worked as a researcher at KIST before joining Yonsei University. Research Interests formal languages and automata theory, algorithm design, information retrieval and NLP Publications Journal Conference in Google Scholar in DBLP Recruitment click for more info in Korean I am looking for excellent PhD and master students who work together to solve many interesting CS problems. I am also offering an internship program to undergraduate students (who want to know more about theoretical computer science) at any time. One can find out my recent research interests from the list of publications. If a student wants to know more about my research and/or is interested in working with me, please email me. Recent Teachings (UG) Data Structures, Automata and Formal Languages (PG) Theory of Computation, Analysis of Algorithms Upcoming conferences related to formal languages CIAA 2025 (Italy) PC member DCFS 2025 (UK), PC member DLT 2025 (South Korea), PC member Useful or interesting links DBLP publication search A few rules with advice on scientific writing
